business.headline: India can become the AI capital of the world: Meta's Sandhya DevanathanSandhya Devanathan, Vice President and Head of India at Meta, discusses the company's AI initiatives, including Meta AI and Llama models.

We are going to be future ready: Priyank Kharge on AI transforming job marketSharing his thoughts on AI creating a job deficit, Priyank Kharge, Minister of IT and Biotechnology of Karnataka said that technological evolution creates new opportunities rather than eliminating them.

Forging the future: CP Gurnani, Aditya Ghosh discuss AI's role in empowering IndiaCP Gurnani highlighted the necessity of blending AI with human capabilities. Aditya Ghosh emphasised the accessibility of AI, calling this era a "magical time" akin to the Industrial Revolution.

Firms using AI to empower workforce likely to excel in future: Professor Das NarayandasSpeaking at the India Today-Business Today AI Conference 2024, during a session titled 'Leadership.Change.AI', he emphasised that organisations focusing on how AI can augment their workforce are likely to emerge as industry leaders.

Paytm share price hits 52-week high today. What's driving the rally?Paytm share price: The stock jumped 3.60% to hit a 52-week high of Rs 990.90 on Friday. At the closing bell, the stock settled 1.89% higher at Rs 974.55.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as RBI maintains status quo on interest ratesThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 56.74 points to end at 81,709.12, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 30.60 points to close at 24,677.80.
Insurance claims denied? Nithin Kamath explains why and what you can doNithin Kamath warns that having insurance doesn't guarantee full claims and lists common rejection reasons.

MCX share price hits Rs 7,000 milestone as stock rallies over 8%The stock has delivered an impressive growth trajectory, with gains of over 100% in the past year, over 300% in the last three years, and more than 500% over the last five years.

Explained: Why Vedanta share price jumped over 6% todayThe surge in stock price follows an announcement from Vedanta Resources Finance II PLC, a subsidiary of VRL, that it had redeemed the full amount of $1.2 billion in bonds due in 2025 but extended to 2028.

RBI MPC: Homebuyers may have to wait till 2025 for EMI reliefThe RBI has kept key lending rates unchanged with Governor Shaktikanta Das explaining the Monetary Policy Committee's (MPC) focus on economic stability.

RBI cuts CRR to 4%: How this liquidity boost will benefit economyThe decision to cut CRR is expected to benefit the banking sector, particularly public sector banks, by lowering the cost of funds and increasing lending capacity.

EPFO extends deadline to activate UAN for ELI scheme. Check final dateThe EPFO has extended the deadline to link UAN and Aadhaar under the ELI scheme to mid-December, aiming to boost job creation with incentives for employees and employers.
RBI MPC announcement: 7 important decisions you should know aboutThe Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy update includes key decisions like CRR reduction, increase in farm loan limits and more.

RBI increases UPI Lite transaction limit: How will you benefit?The RBI has increased transaction limits for UPI Lite, making digital payments more convenient, flexible, and accessible for customers, especially for low-value and offline transactions.

'Our job is…': RBI Governor defends policy amid criticism over lending ratesShaktikanta Das explained that the decision to hold rates stems from a dual focus on managing inflation and supporting growth. He acknowledged the recent rise in inflation, primarily due to food prices, and the moderation in economic growth

What is Cash Reserve Ratio? Understanding RBI's liquidity management toolThe RBI cut the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4% on December 6, injecting Rs 1.16 lakh crore into the banking system to boost liquidity, credit flow, and economic growth.
RBI keeps key rates unchanged, cuts CRR to 4%: What it means for stock marketAt 11:23 am, the Sensex was down 13.04 points at 81,752.82, while the Nifty50 declined 12.05 points to trade at 24,695.80.

Lower GDP forecast to CRR boost: 6 key takeaways from RBI MPCThe MPC decided by a 4-2 majority to maintain the policy repo rate at 6.5%. Governor Shaktikanta Das explained that this decision was based on an assessment of the economy and financial conditions.
RBI reduces CRR to 4% for liquidity boost. 3 things to know The RBI MPC has kept the key lending rates unchanged to 6.5% as its focus remains on bringing inflation under control.

RBI keeps key lending rate unchanged at 6.5%, focus remains on tackling inflationRBI MPC: Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Monetary Policy Committee has decided to keep the repo rate unchanged and continue with its neutral stance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Amit Shah busy with polls: Arvind Kejriwal's dig after twin Delhi murdersArvind Kejriwal blamed Amit Shah for the rise in crime in Delhi, alleging that the Union Home Minister, under whose jurisdiction the Delhi Police falls, is occupied with elections.

Mamata Banerjee as INDIA chief? Samajwadi Party backs, Congress opposesWhile the Samajwadi Party said Mamata Banerjee as INDIA bloc chief would strengthen the alliance following back-to-back poll losses in Haryana and Maharashtra, the Congress voiced its opposition.

US man mistaken for UnitedHealthcare CEO's killer: 'This can get me killed'A US man received death threats after a viral social media post falsely identified him as the killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

2nd Test, Day 2 Live: Scott Boland strikes first ball, removes JaiswalIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) 2nd Test, Day 2 Live Updates and Reactions: Scott Boland strikes in his very first ball and dismisses Yashasvi Jaiswal. Virat Kohli has now joined Shubman Gill as India try to go home unscathed from here on, on Day 2. Earlier, Travis Head's hundred gave Australia (337) a 157-run lead vs India.

Is Bigg Boss losing its edge? Too much drama or scripted fights?Once hailed as the epitome of drama, controversy, and unfiltered entertainment, Bigg Boss has long been a mainstay of Indian reality television. However, with its declining viewership, both fans and celebrity contestants have expressed concerns about the show's recent trajectory.

Another Iskcon centre in Bangladesh set on fire, idol damaged: ReportSpeaking to the media, Iskcon Kolkata vice president Radharamn Das said that the targetted attack on members of the Iskcon community and members of the Vaishnavite order goes on unabated as "vandals set ablaze idols inside the temple at the Namhatta property."

Sunil Gavaskar blasts Mohammed Siraj for 'unnecessary' send-off to Travis headAUS vs IND 2nd Test: Former India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has lashed out at fast bowler Mohammed Siraj for his fiery send off to Travis Head during Day 2 of the second Test against Australia.

AR Rahman's daughter addresses reports of his career break after separationAcclaimed composer AR Rahman's daughter, Khatija Rahman, recently dismissed reports that the musician would be taking a year-long break after his separation announcement.

What's Bayraktar TB2 drone deployed by Bangladesh and is India prepared?Bangladesh has deployed the Bayraktar TB2 drones on the border with India. These are the same drones that helped Azerbaijan beat the much superior Armenian forces decisively in the battle of Nogorno-Karabakh in 2021. This is how prepared India is to the drone challenge in its neighbourhood.
University of Bath School of Management: A Leader in Global Business EducationCombining top-ranked MSc programmes with practical knowledge for future corporate leaders.

Samajwadi Party to quit alliance over Uddhav Sena leader's Babri Masjid postThe move by the Samajwadi Party, which has 2 MLAs, came after Sena (UBT) MLC Milind Narvekar gave a newspaper ad and hailed the demolition of the mosque on the 32nd anniversary of the incident.

Jasprit Bumrah injured? Fast bowler faces massive scare in AdelaideStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah faced an injury scare during the second session of Day 2 of the second Test against Australia in Adelaide.

Janhvi Kapoor weighs in on the Pushpa 2 Vs Interstellar IMAX debateActor Janhvi Kapoor weighed in on the ongoing Pushap 2 Vs Interstellar debate. This comes amid Christopher Nolan's film's re-release being postponed after Allu Arjun's film took over all the IMAX screens in the country.

Bengaluru man records private videos of girlfriend, extorts Rs 2.57 croreAccording to the police, the accused was a schoolmate of the woman. On the pretext of marrying the woman, the accused recorded her intimate photos and videos. He then started blackmailing her.

Can Indian Parliament do what South Korean Parliament did on martial law?The President of South Korea declared martial law last week. That was, however, overturned by Parliament within hours. This raises questions about emergency powers for the executive in other democracies, like India. What are the guard rails in India that would prevent the imposition of an Emergency like was done by Indira Gandhi?

Pushpa 2 box office Day 2: Allu Arjun's film earns Rs 400 crore globallyAllu Arjun's Pushpa 2 has been breaking several records at the box office. After a bumping opening, the film earned Rs 400 crore worldwide.

Pilates vs weight training: Which one helps you lose weight faster?Pilates was developed by Joseph Pilates in the early 20th century during World War I as a method to rehabilitate injured soldiers and dancers.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Man shares 2 reasons for quitting Rs 1 crore job in Bengaluru without another offerIn a series of posts on X, a man shared two reasons for quitting Rs 1 crore job in Bengaluru without another offer in hand.

Delhi shocker: Trader on morning walk shot dead, man killed over unclean toiletDelhi murders: A trader out on a morning walk was shot dead by bike-borne assailants in northeast Delhi's Shahdara, while a man was stabbed to death during a brawl in Govindpuri.

Syrian rebels capture 4th city, inch closer to Damascus as Assad's grip weakensWith Russia preoccupied with its war in Ukraine and Hezbollah weakened by a yearlong conflict with Israel, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad appears to be largely on his own in the fresh fight against the rebels.

Maharashtra Opposition MLAs boycott Mahayuti government's oath in assemblyOn the first day of the three-day special session of the Maharashtra assembly, 287 newly elected MLAs will be sworn in. Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray said opposition MLAs would not take oath today to protest against "EVM tampering".

2 top Indian community members stripped of their honours by King Charles Raminder Singh Ranger was awarded the CBE, the third-highest honour in the Order of the British Empire, in 2015 for his contributions to British business and the Asian community.

At 7.1°C, Delhi wakes up to coldest morning of season, air quality 'poor' againDelhi on Saturday experienced its coldest morning of the season, with the minimum temperature plunging to 7.1 degrees Celsius. The city's air quality also took a turn for the worse, slipping back into the 'poor' category.

Ariana Grande on criticism of her looks: Heard every version of what's wrongAmerican singer and actor Ariana Grande recently opened up about coping with beauty standards and said that she has been facing public scrutiny since she was a teenager.

Watch: Salman Khan's dance rehearsal ahead of Da-Bangg tour in DubaiSalman Khan is all set to take the stage and enthrall fans with his performance at the Da-Bangg The Tour-Reloaded in Dubai today. Ahead of the grand show, the actor's video from the rehearsals has gone viral.

AR Rahman's daughter addresses reports of his career break after separationAcclaimed composer AR Rahman's daughter, Khatija Rahman, recently dismissed reports that the musician would be taking a year-long break after his separation announcement.

BB 18: Eisha Singh, Digvijay Rathee get into a heated argumentIn the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Eisha Singh and Digvijay Rathee got into an intense fight. Their argument escalated after Sara Arfeen Khan and Avinash Mishra got in between the same.

More money? New coach reveals why Rishabh Pant left Delhi ahead of IPL auctionIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant denied speculation that his departure from the Delhi Capitals was financially motivated, but newly appointed head coach Hemang Badani revealed that the wicketkeeper had chosen not to be retained, preferring instead to test the market in the auction.

India never put Travis Head under pressure: Gavaskar baffled by bowling tacticsSunil Gavaskar slammed the Indian bowlers and their strategy against Travis Head as the Australian batter scored a fine hundred on Day 2 of the pink-ball Test. Head put the Indian bowlers to the sword yet again with his aggressive batting.

Adelaide crowd boos Mohammed Siraj after explosive send-off to Travis Head Australia vs India, 2nd Test: Mohammed Siraj was booed by the Adelaide Oval crowd on Saturday after he gave an explosive send-off to local hero Travis Head. The Australian batting star tore into the Indian bowling attack, hitting a 141-ball 140.

Steve Smith will have his stumps attacked until he regains form: Matthew HaydenFormer Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden feels that doubts have crept in the mind of Steve Smith due to his poor form. Jasprit Bumrah got Smith out for the third time in his career.

Watch: Travis Head dedicates Adelaide hundred vs India to newborn baby HarrisonIn a heartwarming moment, Australia batter Travis Head dedicated his Adelaide hundred against India to his newborn baby Harrison on Day 2 of the pink-ball Test on Saturday, December 7.

Travis Head emulates Don Bradman with 3rd Test hundred in AdelaideAUS vs IND, 2nd Test: Travis Head continued his love affair with the Adelaide Oval, hitting his third Test hundred at the iconic venue. Head's onslaught pushed India onto the back foot on Saturday.

Blunders aplenty: Rohit Sharma's captaincy in Adelaide Test under the scannerAUS vs IND, 2nd Test: Rohit Sharma's decision to give only four overs to Jasprit Bumrah on Day 2 morning and bring R Ashwin into the attack late have raised concerns about his captaincy. Australia raced past India's first innings total of 180 on Sautrday morning despite losing three wickets.

NZ vs ENG, 2nd Test: Atkinson hat-trick, Bethell 98 put England in driver's seatEngland finished Day 2 of the of the second Test against New Zealand in a commanding position leading by 533 runs as they were 378/5 in the second innings. Earlier, New Zealand were bundled out for just 125 in first innings.

Harshit Rana experiment should end: Fans slam selection after Adelaide horror spell IND vs AUS, 2nd Test: Harshit Rana conceded 38 runs in a five-over spell on Day 2 morning. His ordinary effort released the pressure that Jasprit Bumrah built with two early wickets.

Pink-ball Test: Fiery Mohammed Siraj celebrappeals, sledges Labuschagne on Day 2 Australia vs India, 2nd Test: Mohammed Siraj was at his fiery best on Saturday morning in Adelaide. Despite bowling his heart out in an extended seven-over spell, the fast bowler did not pick up a wicket.

Watch: Virat Kohli sledges struggling Labuschange during Adelaide TestIND vs AUS, 2nd Test: Senior India player Virat Kohli tried to unsettle Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne late on Day 1 of the Adelaide Test match. Kohli's chatter went viral after  the stump mic was able to catch his words.

Stop the trolls. Yashasvi Jaiswal's sledge to Starc was banter, not disrespectAUS vs IND, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal's cheeky sledge to Mitchell Starc in Perth drew criticism after his golden duck in Adelaide. But is the backlash fair for a young batter making his mark on his maiden tour of Australia?

KL Rahul and Shubman showed good intent in Adelaide: PujaraIndia's batting woes continued as Mitchell Starc dismantled the lineup, but KL Rahul and Shubman Gill offered a glimmer of hope with their promising partnership. Day 2 presents a daunting challenge for Rohit Sharma's side to reclaim control.

Sumit Nagal earns direct main-draw entry, Nick Kyrgios returnsAustralian Open 2025: India's Sumit Nagal earned a direct entry into the main draw of the hard-court major. Nick Kyrgios will be making his Grand Slam return since last playing in the US Open 2022.

Pathum Nissanka's 89 steadies Sri Lanka after Kyle Verreynne's 105SA vs SL: Sri Lanka trailed by 116 runs at the close of play on the second day after Pathum Nissanka scored 89. Earlier in the day, Kyle Verreynne guided South Africa with his third Test century.

Angelo Mathews joins elite Sri Lanka club with 8000 Test runs SA vs SL, 1st Test, Day 2: Angelo Mathews became the third Sri Lankan batter after Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene to score 8000 runs in Test cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
